thread.title: Plug and Play accepts 175 startups into its latest accelerator program
thread.title_full: Plug and Play accepts 175 startups into its latest accelerator program

author: Luke Stangel
title: Plug and Play accepts 175 startups into its latest accelerator program
text: Plug and Play founder and CEO Saeed Amidi. The Sunnyvale-based accelerator program… more Vicki Thompson This group of startups, which represents the largest cohort in Plug and Play’s history, will be separated into nine programs based on their company’s focus. Each program will host weekly educational sessions with mentors, experts, partners and investors, as well as larger, program-wide networking activities ahead of the cohort’s demo day in June . Plug and Play’s accelerator differs from others, in that the company takes no equity from its participants, spokeswoman Allison Romero said. Startups get free desk space in Sunnyvale and free meals through the duration of the program. Between now and June, Plug and Play’s goal will be to identify the most promising startups in the program, and invest in those. Plug and Play runs a total of 11 accelerator programs, in partnership with large corporations. Plug and Play’s Winter 2016 accelerator class had 105 participants. The complete list of the Spring 2017 class is on Plug and Play’s website . Related Content
